page.title: 04BRISHING COURT FARM
page.content: The land and farm of Brishing Court have been in the possession of the Skinner family for 150 or so years. The person that was interviewed, who is not a member of the family, has been working there for the past 25 years. The house itself is over 500 years old; while the 17th century Lord Fairfax was living at nearby Leeds Castle, his mother was living at Brishing Court. Mr Billy Skinner now lives here and works the farm. Potatoes, hard fruit and corn are grown on the 60 hectares (170 acres) of land, and there is grazing for 550 sheep and lambs, some of which are also sometimes grazed on the Loose Swiss Scout land further down the valley.
